title: Task 1: Describe visual elements of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately describe one visual characteristic of Summer Trees.
Response accurately describes one visual characteristic of Summer Trees
Response accurately describes two visual characteristic of Summer Trees.

title: Task 2: Explain how a specific work of art demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific visual evidence to explain how one characteristic of Summer Trees references earlier painting traditions.
Response does accurately use specific visual evidence to explain how one characteristic of Summer Trees references earlier painting traditions.

title: Task 3: Explain how a specific work of art demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific visual evidence to explain how one characteristic of Summer Trees departs from earlier painting traditions.
Response does accurately use specific visual evidence to explain how one characteristic of Summer Trees departs from earlier painting traditions.

title: Task 4: Explain the meaning or significance of continuity and/or change between works of art (or group of related works of art) within a related artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific contextual evidence to explain why Song Su-namâ€™s artistic decisions in creating Summer Trees were influenced by earlier painting traditions.
